title: Sine and Cosine - area of triangle

content.description: The circle passes through the points (1 comma 0) and (0 comma 1). Point Q is on the x axis between the origin and (1 comma 0). Point P is at the intersection of the circle and a ray from the origin into the first quadrant. A segment from point P to point Q is perpendicular to the x axis. A right triangle is formed by the origin, point P, and point Q. ​
content.question: ​​The figure shows the terminal ray of an angle in standard position intersecting the unit circle at point <math alttext="P"><semantics><mi>P</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> in the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane. The function <math alttext="A"><semantics><mi>A</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> gives the area of the triangle, <math alttext="A open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>A</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, based on the measure of the angle <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, in radians.
